column14: This is so sick man! Big well done to both of you! One of the things I find amazing about this group (and musicianship in general) is that we all naturally pull towards creativity as a means of entertaining ourselves, as apposed to wasting time on meaningless endeavours and projects! I think this is something that you both highlight here.. just the pure fulfilment of making music. It's amazing, and I highly respect your proactivity and creativity. Well done!!

column33: That is a LOT of music on 6 strings! It really is a faithful rendering. (I don't play this song but I thought the very last note of the chorus ["when you get >HOME<) was 1/2 step lower than that.....]
column34: I love this. I can hear the words as you play the song. That's so important. Also, you and I have a different idea of what the melody is. It's hard to tell on these Dan songs because the harmonies are so tight and every note seems as important as the other one. Also, you decided to play the major third on "when you get HOME" and I always sing the minor. So interesting and awesome to hear!
column35: Also, I wasn't just talking about that note. I was talking about a good chunk of the chorus. You played something different than I would've played for them whole melody. I love that.
column36: One of my favorite tunes ever. You've done a marvelous job on this one, man.
